hackathon-description-text: The IoT Challenge is a 3 day hackathon being run by the University of Edinburgh Embedded and Robotics Society (EaRS). Participants will build their own IoT application using hardware provided by Information Services and EaRS. The hackathon has been kindly sponsored by Microsoft and every participant will receive $100 of Azure credit to help build their back-end.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Arduino Uno and an ultrasonic sensor for each participant. Chocolate!
Arduino Nano and ultrasonic sensor for each participant. Chocolate!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3 Lady Lawson St, Edinburgh EH3 9DS, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The technical skills and challenges involved in the hack.
How innovative the idea is combined with the cool factor of it.
How well the application has been polished. Whether it feels like a real thing.

hackathon-location-address: 3 Lady Lawson St, Edinburgh EH3 9DS, UK
hackathon-description-header: Learn about IoT through building an application of your own!
